name: Firecrawl MCP - Sponsor Video Research Agent

attributes.name: senderFirstName
attributes.description: The sender's first name. Look for signatures like "Best regards, Jacinth" or "Thanks, John". Extract just the first name. If the From field has a name like "ÊùéËéπËéπ", look in the email body for an English name in the signature.

attributes.name: senderFullName
attributes.description: The sender's full name if available.

attributes.name: senderRole
attributes.description: Sender's job title/role if mentioned (e.g., 'Marketing Manager', 'Developer Advocate', 'CEO').

attributes.name: companyName
attributes.description: The company or organization name. Look for explicit mentions or derive from email domain.

attributes.name: productName
attributes.description: The specific product or tool name mentioned in the email. Look in the subject line and body. Examples: "Z.ai", "Cursor", "Supabase". Do NOT use the domain name - find the actual product name.

attributes.name: productCategory
attributes.description: Categorize: 'AI/ML tools', 'API development', 'Database', 'Developer productivity', 'DevOps/Infrastructure', 'Automation/Workflow', 'Security', 'Analytics/Monitoring', 'Cloud services', 'Code editor/IDE', 'Testing', 'Other'

attributes.name: productDescription
attributes.description: One-line description of what the product does based on the email content.

attributes.name: keyFeatures
attributes.description: List key features/capabilities mentioned, comma-separated. Be specific with tech names.

attributes.name: integrations
attributes.description: Any integrations mentioned (e.g., 'GitHub, VS Code, Slack'). Return 'not mentioned' if none.

attributes.name: targetAudience
attributes.description: Who is this product for? (e.g., 'backend developers', 'DevOps engineers', 'data scientists')

attributes.name: competitorsMentioned
attributes.description: Any competitor products mentioned or implied (e.g., 'alternative to Postman'). Return 'none' if not mentioned.

attributes.name: specificAsk
attributes.description: Any specific content they requested (e.g., 'show the API feature', 'compare with X').

attributes.name: budgetMentioned
attributes.description: Any budget/compensation mentioned. Return exact amount if stated, otherwise 'not mentioned'.

attributes.name: timeline
attributes.description: Any deadline or timeline mentioned. Return 'flexible' if none specified.

attributes.name: whyEricChannel
attributes.description: Did they mention why they chose Eric's channel? What resonated with them?

options.systemPromptTemplate: You are an expert at analyzing sponsorship inquiry emails for a tech YouTube channel. Extract accurate, specific information. Be precise with product names and technical details. If something is not explicitly stated, make a reasonable inference based on context but mark uncertain fields appropriately. Never leave required fields empty.

parameters.text:
==Research {{ $json.productName }} and write a video direction. SPONSOR INFO: Contact: {{ $json.senderFirstName }} Company: {{ $json.companyName }} Product: {{ $json.productName }} Category: {{ $json.productCategory }} Features: {{ $json.keyFeatures || 'Not specified' }} URL: {{ $('Format Email').item.json.companyUrl }} EMAIL: {{ $('Format Email').item.json.latestMessage }} STEPS: 1. Scrape {{ $('Format Email').item.json.companyUrl }} 2. Search "{{ $json.productName }} tutorial" ‚Üí Scrape top result 3. Search "{{ $json.productName }} vs" ‚Üí Scrape top result 4. Write email below OUTPUT (HTML only):

Hey {{ $json.senderFirstName }},

Researched {{ $json.productName }}. Here's my direction:

Research

  • Product: [specific features from scrape]
  • Market: [what devs say from search results]
  • Gap: [what's missing in existing content]

Angle

[unique hook for Eric's audience]

Demo Plan

  • [Feature] ‚Üí [pain point] ‚Üí [time saved]
  • [Feature] ‚Üí [pain point] ‚Üí [time saved]

Next Steps

Need: [access required]. Timeline: 7-10 days.

Best,
Eric

options.systemMessage:
You are Eric's Video Research AI.

TOOL PATTERN:
1. firecrawl_scrape: {"url": "https://example.com"} - Read full page
2. firecrawl_search: {"query": "simple terms", "limit": 3} - Get URLs

RESEARCH STEPS (4-5 tool calls max):
1. Scrape company website
2. Search "[product] tutorial 2025" ‚Üí Scrape top 1 result
3. Search "[product] vs alternative" ‚Üí Scrape top 1 result

CHANNEL CONTEXT:
- 30K subs, senior devs & technical founders
- Style: No-BS, fast demos, working code
- Top hits: Gemini CLI (85K), Job Automation (60K)

OUTPUT RULES:
- Clean HTML only
- Every claim needs specific details from research
- Under 300 words

parameters.jsCode:
const extracted = $input.item.json || {};
const emailData = $('Format Email').item.json;

return {
  json: {
    // Extracted fields with defaults
    senderFirstName: extracted.senderFirstName || 'there',
    senderFullName: extracted.senderFullName || '',
    senderRole: extracted.senderRole || '',
    companyName: extracted.companyName || emailData.senderDomain || 'Unknown Company',
    productName: extracted.productName || 'their product',
    productCategory: extracted.productCategory || 'Developer tools',
    productDescription: extracted.productDescription || '',
    keyFeatures: extracted.keyFeatures || '',
    integrations: extracted.integrations || 'not mentioned',
    targetAudience: extracted.targetAudience || 'developers',
    competitorsMentioned: extracted.competitorsMentioned || 'none',
    sponsorshipType: extracted.sponsorshipType || 'unclear',
    specificAsk: extracted.specificAsk || '',
    budgetMentioned: extracted.budgetMentioned || 'not mentioned',
    timeline: extracted.timeline || 'flexible',
    whyEricChannel: extracted.whyEricChannel || '',
    toneAndStyle: extracted.toneAndStyle || 'casual/friendly',
    
    // Pass through email data
    emailId: emailData.emailId,
    threadId: emailData.threadId,
    from: emailData.from,
    subject: emailData.subject,
    companyUrl: emailData.companyUrl,
    senderDomain: emailData.senderDomain,
    latestMessage: emailData.latestMessage,
    productUrls: emailData.productUrls || [],
    briefUrls: emailData.briefUrls || [],
    labelId: emailData.labelId,
    firecrawlApiKey: emailData.firecrawlApiKey,
    processedLabelId: emailData.processedLabelId
  }
};

parameters.content:
## üîß SETUP INSTRUCTIONS

**1. Config Node (Required)**
- `labelName`: Create a Gmail label for sponsor emails (e.g., "Sponsorship/Research")
- `firecrawlApiKey`: Get from https://firecrawl.dev
- `processedLabelId`: Create a "Processed" label in Gmail, then find its ID

**2. Credentials Needed**
- Gmail OAuth2
- Azure OpenAI (or swap for OpenAI/Anthropic)

**3. How to Get Label IDs**
- Run the "Gmail - Get Labels" node once
- Find your label in the output
- Copy the ID value
